definition: lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: The lads work with furious energy.
sentences.chinese: 小夥子幹起活來真是生龍活虎。

sentences.english: Like tigers the fighters continued up the cliff.
sentences.chinese: 戰士們還是生龍活虎地往懸巖上爬。
這種自由能讓你生龍活虎。

sentences.english: And on the last sighting, capitalism appeared as feisty asever.
sentences.chinese: 而再看最後一眼，資本主義似乎和原來一樣生龍活虎。

sentences.english: The teenagers will thrive on teachers' guidance with full of vim and vigor.
sentences.chinese: 茁壯成長的青少年將在教師的指導與生龍活虎。

definition: smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
